title: Thermae Titi (Tïtianae)
description: Thermae Titi (Tïtianae), or Baths of Titus, were public baths built at Rome in 81 CE under the emperor Titus. Located at the foot of the Esquiline Hill, the baths occupy part of the Domus Aurea of Nero. The Baths of Trajan were constructed immediately adjacent to the Baths of Titus in the early second century.
